column4: trying to install my ati drivers and on the Read me its saying i need  XFree86-Mesa-libGL,libstdc++,libgcc,XFree86-libs,fontconfig,expat,freetype,zlib,gcc....i don't see them in my pakages
Are you trying to install fglrx or the open source drivers?
Are you trying to install fglrx or the open source drivers?
Which of these two are you trying to install, fglrx (ATi's Closed Source driver) or the open source ATi drivers?
Yes, that is how I installed my fglrx drivers for my ATi X1950XTX and it works just fine.
I used this guys installation method to get XGL + Beryl working: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=399913
If your card supports Dual-Link DVI, the install method I gave you for fglrx, will work on any monitor up to a resolution size of 2560x1600
I would have not seen your message as it didn't highlight your name, next time to grab my attention type trumpeter2003 (tru<tab>)
Are you starting Gnome with XGL from your login manager?
As such, did you create all the scripts that were requested? And even more so, did you chmod a+x them?
That means that the Window Manager isn't loading
Which resorts to the scripts not being created correctly or without the correct permissions
Go back through and check that you did all the steps in the guide and didn't skip over any of them
And all the permissions on the scripts are a+x
